meanings.definition: First in order or time; earliest.
meanings.sent1: The prima task in the morning is to brush my teeth.
meanings.sent2: The prima snowflake fell gently from the sky.
meanings.sent3: She always wants to be the prima player in our games.
meanings.sent4: The prima ray of sunlight peeked through the curtains.
meanings.sent5: The prima flower to bloom in spring was a vibrant tulip.

meanings.definition: Of the highest quality or importance.
meanings.sent1: Her prima painting won first place in the art show.
meanings.sent2: The prima ingredient in the recipe is fresh herbs.
meanings.sent3: He proudly displayed his prima trophy on the shelf.
meanings.sent4: The prima jewel sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The prima book in the series was a bestseller.

meanings.definition: A female cousin on one's mother's side.
meanings.sent1: My prima is visiting us from out of town.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy spending time with my prima at family gatherings.
meanings.sent3: We always have fun playing games with our prima.
meanings.sent4: My prima and I share a love for baking cookies.
meanings.sent5: My prima's birthday party is next weekend.
